title: List of dismissals and resignations in the first Trump administration
added: |Resigned following the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|2021 storming of the U.S. Capitol]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=CNN|first=Kate Bennett|title=First lady's chief of staff and White House social secretary resign after violent protests|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/06/politics/stephanie-grisham-white-house-resign/index.html|access-date=2021-01-07|website=CNN}}</ref>

title: List of dismissals and resignations in the first Trump administration
added: |Resignation announced by the Department of Justice on January 7, 2021.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-01-07|title=Assistant Attorney General Eric Dreiband Announces Departure from Civil Rights Division|url=https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/assistant-attorney-general-eric-dreiband-announces-departure-civil-rights-division|access-date=2021-01-07|website=www.justice.gov|language=en}}</ref> The ''New York Times'' noted that his resignation did not specifically refer to the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|events of the prior day]].<ref>{{Cite news|last=Fandos|first=Nicholas|date=2021-01-07|title=Live Updates: Pelosi Says House Will Pursue Impeachment if 25th Amendment Is Not Invoked|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/01/07/us/electoral-vote|access-date=2021-01-07|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>

title: List of dismissals and resignations in the first Trump administration
added: |Special Adviser to the Iran Action Group

|Fired by the White House after writing a tweet condemning the 2021 storming of the U.S. Capitol, referring to President Trump by name.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Pamuk|first=Humeyra|date=2021-01-07|title=White House fires State Department official after tweets critical of Trump|language=en|work=Reuters|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-statedepartment-idUSKBN29C344|access-date=2021-01-08}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=CNN|first=Kylie Atwood|title=State Department political appointee fired by White House after tweeting Trump was unfit for office|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/07/politics/gabriel-noronha-fired-tweet/index.html|access-date=2021-01-08|website=CNN}}</ref>

title: List of dismissals and resignations in the first Trump administration
added: |Originally planning on resigning on January 15, he rescinded his original resignation and submitted a resignation in protest, effective immediately, following the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|2021 storming of the U.S capitol]].<ref>{{Cite news|last=Hudson|first=John|title=In unusual move, top Trump official rescinds cheery exit letter and resubmits a protest resignation|language=en-US|work=Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/in-unusual-move-top-trump-official-rescinds-cheery-exit-letter-and-resubmits-a-protest-resignation/2021/01/08/c4ef97a4-520c-11eb-b2e8-3339e73d9da2_story.html|access-date=2021-01-09|issn=0190-8286}}</ref>
